intro: Anil oligophylla, commonly known as the white thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a spherical, hairy berry that contains several seeds. Anil oligophylla is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
